meanings.definition: Relating to or affecting an entire system.
meanings.sent1: The systemic issue affected all the computers in the network.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified a systemic problem in the company's operations.
meanings.sent3: The systemic glitch in the game made all characters move in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: The systemic failure of the power grid plunged the city into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The systemic changes in the school's curriculum improved student performance.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving systems or systematic procedures.
meanings.sent1: The systemic approach to problem-solving helped streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented a systemic method to track inventory.
meanings.sent3: The systemic way of organizing files made it easy to find documents.
meanings.sent4: The systemic review of the project revealed areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: The systemic training program ensured all employees followed the same protocol.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a system of government or organization.
meanings.sent1: The systemic changes in the organization's structure led to better communication.
meanings.sent2: The new policies aimed to address systemic issues within the government.
meanings.sent3: The systemic restructuring of the department caused confusion among employees.
meanings.sent4: The systemic overhaul of the company's management brought about positive results.
meanings.sent5: The systemic decision-making process ensured transparency and fairness.
